alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 1:26PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Butler, central Monroe, southwestern Crenshaw, Escambia, Conecuh, Covington, northern Okaloosa and northeastern Santa Rosa Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 125 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Monroeville to 14 miles southeast of Riverview. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Andalusia, Atmore, Greenville, Monroeville, Opp, Brewton, Evergreen, Florala, Flomaton, McCullough, Peterman, East Brewton, Georgiana, McKenzie, River Falls, Castleberry, Excel, Red Level, Laurel Hill and Lockhart. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Monroe
